intro: Bonnetia anceps, commonly known as the yellow bonnet, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling a crown or helmet, hence its common name. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth surface. Bonnetia anceps is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
